snippet: Hana Shalabi, 30, went more than 40 days without eating to protest her administrative detention, a practice of being held without charge or trial.
abstract: Hana Shalabi, Palestinian woman who went more than 40 days on hunger strike to protest her detention by Israel without charge or trial, is released from Israeli prison and sent into temporary exile in Gaza under deal reached with Israeli authorities; administrative detention orders can be issued for a maximum of six months, but can be renewed indefinitely; officials say about 300 detainees are currently in Israeli prisons.

byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and FARES AKRAM
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and Fares Akram from Gaza. Khaled Abu Aker contributed reporting from the West Bank.

lead_paragraph: Hana Shalabi, 30, went more than 40 days without eating to protest her administrative detention, a practice of being held without charge or trial.

headline.main: Israel Frees Palestinian Detainee After Hunger Strike of Weeks
headline.print_headline: Israel Frees Palestinian Detainee After Hunger Strike of Weeks
